verses.verse: Blessed are those who dwell in Your ((Ps. 65:4)) house; They will still be praising You. Selah
Blessed is the man whose strength is in You, Whose heart is set on pilgrimage.
As they pass through the Valley (2 Sam. 5:22-25) of Baca, They make it a spring; The rain also covers it with pools.
They go (Prov. 4:18; Is. 40:31; John 1:16; 2 Cor. 3:18) from strength to strength; Each one (Ex. 34:23; Deut. 16:16) appears before God in Zion.
O LORD God of hosts, hear my prayer; Give ear, O God of Jacob! Selah
(Gen. 15:1) O God, behold our shield, And look upon the face of Your anointed.
For a day in Your courts is better than a thousand. I would rather be a doorkeeper in the house of my God Than dwell in the tents of wickedness.

For the LORD God is (Is. 60:19, 20; Mal. 4:2; Rev. 21:23) a sun and (Gen. 15:1) shield; The LORD will give grace and glory; (Ps. 34:9, 10) No good thing will He withhold From those who walk uprightly.
O LORD of hosts, ((Ps. 2:12; 40:4)) Blessed is the man who trusts in You!

Prayer that the LORD Will Restore Favor to the Land To the Chief Musician. A Psalm (Ps. 42:title) of the sons of Korah. [1] LORD, You have been favorable to Your land; You have (Ezra 1:11â€”2:1; Ps. 14:7; Jer. 30:18; 31:23; Ezek. 39:25; Hos. 6:11; Joel 3:1) brought back the captivity of Jacob.
You have forgiven the iniquity of Your people; You have covered all their sin. Selah
You have taken away all Your wrath; You have turned from the fierceness of Your anger.
(Ps. 80:3, 7) Restore us, O God of our salvation, And cause Your anger toward us to cease.
